courses.subject: CS 10
courses.title: Introduction to Computing
courses.description:
CS 10 is an introductory course that teaches new Computer Science about the essence of the field of Computing. 

Over the span of the course you get a brief overview of the various topics that you will encounter as you take your undergraduate degree. 

The topics that you will get an overview of include computer storage and number formats, algorithm design, operating systems, the world wide web, computer security and privacy, software design, artificial intelligence, big data, and more.
courses.recommended_textbooks: Introduction to Computer Science: A Textbook for Beginners in Informatics. Gilbert Brands
courses.recommended_websites:
Map of Computer Science —- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SzJ46YA_RaA
UP Diliman's BS Computer Science is NOT what you expect. —- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r6gDMrkFgoQ&t=231s&ab_channel=CarlosPanganiban
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A45p5e86Lpw&ab_channel=SciencephiletheAI

courses.subject: CS 11
courses.title: Computer Programming I
courses.description:
CS 11 is an introductory course that gives Computer Science students their first taste of programming.

In this course you will learn the essentials of any programming language. You will learn about the basic data types such as integers, strings, floats, and lists. Additionally, you will be introduced to the types of operations you can perform with these data types.

You will also learn about the different tools that will help you structure your programs. This includes conditional statements, iterations with for loops and while loops, functions, and recursion. 

Lastly, you will tackle object-oriented programming, a programming paradigm that will help prepare you for making widescale projects in the future.
courses.recommended_textbooks:
Learn Python the Hard Way. Zed Shaw.
Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs. Gerald Jay Sussman and Hal Abelson
courses.recommended_websites: This is CS50 —- https://cs50.harvard.edu/

courses.subject: CS 30
courses.title: Discrete Mathematics for Computer Science I
courses.description:
CS 30 is the third introductory course every computer science student takes in their first semester at UP Diliman. It is a math-intensive course, however, it separates itself from the calculation and number crunching mathematics we know.

Computer science is an application of pure mathematics, which revolves around proving ideas given a set of axioms, or statements that are universally considered true. You will learn about these proving techniques so that you can later use them to prove ideas in computer science, such as the efficiency of an algorithm or if a problem is in fact solvable by a computer.

Some topics you will encounter in this course include logical statements, proof techniques, set theory, and group theory.
courses.recommended_textbooks: Discrete mathematics with applications Book. Susanna S. Epp
courses.recommended_websites: Discrete Mathematics —- http://discrete.openmathbooks.org/dmoi3.html

courses.subject: MATH 21
courses.title: Elementary Analysis I
courses.description:
Math 21 is an introduction to analysis, otherwise know as Calculus. Calculus is essentially the study of how much functions change.

In this course you will learn about limits, continuity, differentiation, and integration.
courses.recommended_textbooks:
Calculus. Bruce H. Edwards and Ron Larson
Calculus Volume 1. Edwin Herman and Gilbert Strang
courses.recommended_websites: Online Math Tutorials and Notes —- https://tutorial.math.lamar.edu/

courses.subject: CS 12
courses.title: Computer Programming I
courses.description: CS 12 is a continuation of CS 11. This course focuses more on Abstract Data Types and advanced programming techniques such as Exception Handling, Documentation, and API Programming. This also serves as a preview of the lessons that will be tackled in CS 32 and CS 33.
courses.recommended_textbooks: Introduction to Algorithms. Thomas H. Cormen, Charles E. Leiserson, Ronald L. Rivest, Clifford Stein
courses.recommended_websites: Dynamic Programming —- https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/dynamic-programming/

courses.subject: CS 31
courses.title: Discrete Mathematics for Computer Science II
courses.description:
CS 31 is the continuation of CS 30. In this course you will learn about more concepts that will help further prepare you for proving concepts related to algorithms. 

Topics that are included in this course include counting principles, graph theory, and discrete probability.
courses.recommended_textbooks: Discrete mathematics with applications Book. Susanna S. Epp
courses.recommended_websites: Discrete Mathematics —- http://discrete.openmathbooks.org/dmoi3.html

courses.subject: MATH 22
courses.title: Elementary Analysis II
courses.description:
Math 22 is the continuation of Math 21, and is perhaps the most challenging chapter in the elementary analysis series.

This course builds on its predecessor and tackles integration techniques, infinite series, parametric equations, polar coordinates, and vectors.
courses.recommended_textbooks:
Calculus. Bruce H. Edwards and Ron Larson
Calculus Volume II. Openstax
courses.recommended_websites: Online Math Tutorials and Notes —- https://tutorial.math.lamar.edu/

courses.subject: PHYSICS 71
courses.title: Elementary Physics I
courses.description:
Physics 71 is an introductory course to elementary physics. The course combines the principles of physics with the methods of calculus in order to answer various questions. Thus, Math 21 is a co-requisite to this course. 

Topics that you may expect in this course include kinematics, or the motion of objects without forces, and dynamics, or the study of motions that results from forces. Additionally, other topics tackled are gravitation and simple harmonic motion.
courses.recommended_textbooks: University Physics Volume I. Jeff Sanny and William Moebs. Openstax
courses.recommended_websites: Crash Course Physics —- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OoO5d5P0Jn4&list=PL58rKAc12lkJZ_AEYekzyKqFtiFXPD2g8&ab_channel=SciencephiletheAISciencephiletheAIVerified

courses.subject: CS 20
courses.title: Digital Electronics and Circuits
courses.description:
CS 20 is the first course that students encounter in the Systems Series.

In this course, you will learn how to design and build hardware systems that can do computations
efficiently and with minimum cost. You will also learn how these systems relate to the computers that we use everyday.
courses.recommended_textbooks:
Digital Design and Computer Architecture. Harris and Harris. 2nd
Edition.
Introduction to Digital Logic Design. John P. Hayes.
courses.recommended_websites:
Computer Logical Organization Tutorial —- https://www.tutorialspoint.com/computer_logical_organization/index.htm
Digital Electronics —- https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLBlnK6fEyqRjMH3mWf6kwqiTbT798eAOm

courses.subject: CS 32
courses.title: Data Structures and Algorithms I
courses.description:
CS 32 is the first of a two-part series in Data Structures and Algorithms.

Topics include time and space complexity of algorithms, linear data structures such as queues, stacks, lists, tables, and hash tables, sorting and searching algorithms, and algorithms that can be used for median and order statistics.
courses.recommended_textbooks:
Introductions to Algorithm 3rd edition (CLRS) by Cormen, Leiserson, Rivest and Stein
Algorithm Design Manual (Skiena) by Skiena
Introduction to the Design and Analysis of Algorithms (Levitin) by Levitin
Data Structures (Quiwa) by Quiwa
courses.recommended_websites:
Design and Analysis of Algorithms —- https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/electrical-engineering-and-computer-science/6-046j-design-and-analysis-of-algorithms-spring-2015/
Introduction to Algorithms —- https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/electrical-engineering-and-computer-science/6-006-introduction-to-algorithms-fall-2011/

courses.subject: MATH 23
courses.title: Elementary Analysis III
courses.description:
Math 23 is the continuation of Math 22. It mainly deals with the Calculus of multivariable functions.

This course builds on its predecessor and tackles partial derivatives, extrema of multivariable functions, double and triple integrals, surface integrals, and vector fields.
courses.recommended_textbooks:
Calculus: Early Transcendentals, 7th ed. Anton, H., Bivens, I.C., Davis, S.
The Calculus 7, Leithold, L., 
Calculus: Early Transcendentals, 6th ed. Stewart, J.
courses.recommended_websites:
Calculus 3 —- https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLDesaqWTN6ESk16YRmzuJ8f6-rnuy0Ry7
Calculus III: Multivariable Calculus —- https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLHXZ9OQGMqxc_CvEy7xBKRQr6I214QJcd

courses.subject: PHYSICS 72
courses.title: Elementary Physics II
courses.description:
This course serves as an introduction to the classical theory of electricity, magnetism, and light.

1) Understand the basic laws governing electricity, magnetism, and light.
2) Analyze and systematically solve problems using physical principles.
courses.recommended_textbooks: University Physics Volume 2 by Jeff Sanny and William Moebs
courses.recommended_websites:
8.02x - MIT Physics II —- https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLyQSN7X0ro2314mKyUiOILaOC2hk6Pc3j
Physics 2 —- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rHgKLIYcZOI&t=7s

courses.subject: CS 21
courses.title: Computer Organization and Architecture
courses.description:
CS 21 is the second course in the Systems Series and it continues from CS 20.

Topics include MIPS architecture, assembly and machine language, microarchitecture datapath and control units.
courses.recommended_textbooks:
Digital Design and Computer Architecture. Harris and Harris. 2nd
Edition.
MIPS Assembly Language Programming. Robert L. Britton. 2004 edition
courses.recommended_websites:
Logic Gates With NPN Transistors —- https://www.instructables.com/Logic-Gates-with-NPN-transistors/
York University - Computer Organization and Architecture —- https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL-Mfq5QS-s8iUJpNzCOtQKRfpswCrPbiW

courses.subject: CS 33
courses.title: Data Structures and Algorithms II
courses.description:
CS 33 is the second course in Data Structures and Algorithms. It continues from CS 32

Topics include non linear data structures such as trees and graphs and their applications in Computer Science, and various algorithmic paradigms like Dynamic Programming and Greedy Algorithms.
courses.recommended_textbooks:
Introductions to Algorithm 3rd edition (CLRS) by Cormen, Leiserson, Rivest and Stein
Algorithm Design Manual (Skiena) by Skiena
Introduction to the Design and Analysis of Algorithms (Levitin) by Levitin
Data Structures (Quiwa) by Quiwa
courses.recommended_websites:
A Visual Introduction to Algorithms —- https://www.educative.io/courses/visual-introduction-to-algorithms
Design and Analysis of Algorithms —- https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/electrical-engineering-and-computer-science/6-046j-design-and-analysis-of-algorithms-spring-2015/
Introduction to Algorithms —- https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/electrical-engineering-and-computer-science/6-006-introduction-to-algorithms-fall-2011/

courses.subject: CS 136
courses.title: Elementary Numerical Computing I
courses.description:
CS 136 is the first course about Scientific Computation.

Topics include elementary differential equations, introduction to numerical analysis, root-finding methods, and the collocation method.
courses.recommended_textbooks:
Differential Equations. Reinville and Bedient.
Elementary Differential Equations. Edwards and Penney.
Scientific Computing. Heath.
courses.recommended_websites:
Differential Equations —- https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL96AE8D9C68FEB902
Numerical Computation 2018 —- https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLbxFfU5GKZz3D4NPYvvY7dvXiZ0awd4zn

courses.subject: MATH 40
courses.title: Linear Algebra
courses.description:
Math 40 is a course about Linear Algebra. Linear Algebra is the branch of mathematics that deals with linear equations.

Topics include vector spaces, linear transformations, matrices, eigenvalues, canonical forms, orthogonality, applications.
courses.recommended_textbooks:
Bernard Kolman, David Hill - Elementary Linear Algebra with Applications (9th Edition) -Prentice Hall (2007)
Bernard Kolman, David R. Hill - Instructor's Solutions Manual for Elementary Linear Algebra with Applications, 9th Edition -Pearson (2008)
Richard Bronson, Gabriel B. Costa - Linear algebra_ An introduction- AP (2007)
courses.recommended_websites: Linear Algebra —- https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLDDGPdw7e6AjJacaEe9awozSaOou-NIx_

courses.subject: CS 140
courses.title: Operating Systems
courses.description:
CS 140 is the third course in the Systems Series. In this course you will learn about UNIX-based operating system, and the major components of operating systems. 

Topics included are Processes and Threads, Synchronization, Memory Management, and Distributed Systems
courses.recommended_textbooks:
Operating Systems: Three Easy Pieces. Remzi H. Arpaci-Dusseau and Andrea C. Arpaci-Dusseau
Understanding Operating Systems (Advanced Topics) 6th Edition. Ann McHoes and Ida M. Flynn
courses.recommended_websites: Operating Systems: Three Easy Pieces —- http://pages.cs.wisc.edu/~remzi/OSTEP/

courses.subject: CS 150
courses.title: Programming Languages
courses.description:
CS 150 is a course that serves as an introduction to theory, design, and implementation of programming languages.

Topics include semantics of programming languages, higher-order functions, and lambda calculus.
courses.recommended_textbooks: Programming Languages: Application and Interpretation. Shiram Krishnamurthi
courses.recommended_websites: Programming Languages: Application and Interpretation —- http://www.cs.brown.edu/courses/cs173/2012/book/

courses.subject: CS 165
courses.title: Database Systems
courses.description:
CS 165 tackles the core concepts of database systems. 

Topics to be tackled include data models, query languages, and database processing
courses.recommended_textbooks: Database System Concepts. Avi Silberschatz. Henry F. Korth. S. Sudarshan
courses.recommended_websites: Database Systems —- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4cWkVbC2bNE

courses.subject: CS 191
courses.title: Software Engineering I
courses.description:
CS 191 is the first subject in a two-course series that tackles Software Engineering. 

Topics covered in this course include Software Project management, requirements engineering, and systems analysis and design.
courses.recommended_textbooks: Software Engineering. Ivan Marsic
courses.recommended_websites: Software Engineering —- https://www.ece.rutgers.edu/~marsic/books/SE/

courses.subject: CS 138
courses.title: Elementary Numerical Computing II
courses.description: CS 138 is the continuation of CS 136. Topics that are tacked in this course include Partial Differential Equations, Fourier Series, and Fourier Transformations.
courses.recommended_textbooks:
Differential Equations. Reinville and Bedient.
Elementary Differential Equations. Edwards and Penney.
courses.recommended_websites: Online Math Tutorials and Notes —- https://tutorial.math.lamar.edu/

courses.subject: CS 145
courses.title: Computer Networks
courses.description:
CS 145 is a course that provides an introduction to computer networks.

Topics tackled in this course include network models and layers, terminal and file transfer protocols, message handling protocols, network interconnection, and more.
courses.recommended_textbooks: Data communications and networking 5th edition. Behrouz A. Forouzan
courses.recommended_websites: Computer Networking Complete Course - Beginner to Advanced —- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QKfk7YFILws

courses.subject: CS 153
courses.title: Introduction to Computer Security
courses.description:
CS 153 gives an introduction to computer security. 

Topics included in this course are computer security models and protocols, security issues, and cryptographic algorithms and digital signatures.
courses.recommended_textbooks: CompTIA Security+ Get Certified Get Ahead: SY0-501 Study Guide. Darril Gibson.
courses.recommended_websites: Complete IT Security Course By Google —- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6MYF6Zo6i6A

courses.subject: CS 180
courses.title: Artificial Intelligence
courses.description:
CS 180 is an introductory course to Artificial Intelligence. 

Topics included in this course are the fundamental principles of artificial intelligence, search methods, knowledge representation and reasoning, and more.
courses.recommended_textbooks: Artificial Intelligence A Modern Approach 3rd Edition. Stuart Russell. Peter Norvig.
courses.recommended_websites: Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach —- http://aima.cs.berkeley.edu/

courses.subject: CS 192
courses.title: Software Engineering II
courses.description:
CS 192 is the second part in the two-course series that tackles Software Engineering. 

It builds on the topic of risk management and mitigation previously introduced in Software Engineering I. Other topics include component-based software development, distributed systems engineering, service-oriented software engineering, and software documentation.
courses.recommended_textbooks: Software Engineering. Peason. Sommerville, I (2016)
courses.recommended_websites: Software Engineering II Lecture Notes —- http://www2.cs.uidaho.edu/~jeffery/courses/384/lecture.html

courses.subject: CS 194
courses.title: Undergraduate Research Seminar
courses.description: CS 194 is a course that prepares Computer Science students who will soon be conducting their research/thesis.
courses.recommended_textbooks: Thesis Projects: A Guide for Students in Computer Science and Information Systems 2nd Edition. Mikael Berndtsson, Jörgen Hansson, B. Olsson, Björn Lundell.
courses.recommended_websites:
UPD DCS Research Labs —- https://dcs.upd.edu.ph/research/
How to write your first computer science research paper? —- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j1DvCavAmhE

courses.subject: CS 195
courses.title: Practicum
courses.description: CS 195 is college internship. It is taken in the midyear.
courses.recommended_textbooks:
The Resume Writing Guide. Lisa McGrimmon.
The Google Resume. Gayle Laakmann McDowell
courses.recommended_websites: How to get a Software Engineering Internship —- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LuUpeVfN-wc

courses.subject: CS 133
courses.title: Automata Theory and Computability
courses.description:
CS 133 is a course dedicated to learning how to build automata for Computer Science applications. An automaton is a construct that possesses all the indispensable features of a digital computer.

Topics include regular languages finite automata, DFA and NFA, turing machines, transducers, non-computable languages,
Chomsky hierarchy, and reducibility.
courses.recommended_textbooks: Introduction to the Theory of Computation. Michael Sipser
courses.recommended_websites:
Theory of Computation or Automata Theory —- https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEbnTDJUr_IdM___FmDFBJBz0zCsOFxfK
Theory of Computation & Automata Theory —- https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLBlnK6fEyqRgp46KUv4ZY69yXmpwKOIev

courses.subject: CS 198
courses.title: Special Problems I
courses.description:
CS 198 is the first course is a two-part series about special problems.

The Department of Computer Science in UP Diliman has 8 laboratories that students can choose to do their research:

- Algorithms and Complexity Laboratory
- Computer Security Group
- Computer Vision and Machine Intelligence Group
- Networks and Distributed Systems Group
- Scientific Computing Laboratory
- Service Science and Software Engineering Laboratory
- System Modeling and Simulation Laboratory
- Web Science Group
courses.recommended_textbooks: How to Write a Better Thesis 3rd ed. 2014 Edition. David Evans
courses.recommended_websites:
Research labs —- https://dcs.upd.edu.ph/research/
ACLAB —- https://aclab.dcs.upd.edu.ph/Home
SCL —- https://scl.dcs.upd.edu.ph/
SMSL —- https://sites.google.com/a/dcs.upd.edu.ph/sms/simulating-the-dynamics-of-covid-19
WEB —- https://webscience.dcs.upd.edu.ph/

courses.subject: CS 155
courses.title: Compiler Construction
courses.description: CS 155 is a course about the construction and design of compilers.
courses.recommended_textbooks: Compiler Construction. William M. Waite
courses.recommended_websites:
Compiler Construction —- https://www.cs.cmu.edu/~aplatzer/course/Compilers/waitegoos.pdf
UCLA Lecture Slides —- http://web.cs.ucla.edu/~palsberg/course/cs132/lec.pdf

courses.subject: CS 132
courses.title: Introduction to Data Science
courses.description:
CS 32 is an introductory course that provides the theory and programming skills needed for data science.

Topics include data acquisition and cleaning, handling missing data, data storage, exploratory data analysis, visualization, feature engineering, modeling, interpretation, presentation in the context of real-world datasets.
courses.recommended_textbooks:
Practical Statistics for Data Scientists. Peter Bruce.
Introduction to Machine Learning with Python: A Guide for Data Scientists 1st Edition. Andreas C. Müller.
courses.recommended_websites:
Data Science Full Course For Beginners | Python Data Science Tutorial | Data Science With Python —- https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLeo1K3hjS3us_ELKYSj_Fth2tIEkdKXvV
Online Master’s in Data Science —- https://ischoolonline.berkeley.edu/data-science/

courses.subject: CS 196
courses.title: Seminar on Ethical and Professional Issues in Computing
courses.description: CS 196 is a course usually taken in the last semester of Computer Science majors before graduating and it tackles ethical and professional issues in computing. You will write your final thesis paper in this course.
courses.recommended_textbooks: Ethics in Computing, Science, and Engineering. Blundell, Barry.
courses.recommended_websites: Teaching Ethics and Policy in Computer Science —- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kc2WbkDpQQc

courses.subject: CS 199/200
courses.title: Special Problems II / Undergraduate Thesis
courses.description: CS 199/200 is one of the last courses you will take to attain your undergraduate degree.
courses.recommended_websites: How to write your first computer science research paper? —- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j1DvCavAmhE

courses.subject: KAS 1
courses.title: Kasaysayan ng Pilipinas
courses.description: KAS 1 is a GE 2018 class that provides a brief overview of Philippine History. Students will learn about the country's history from pre-colonial times up to the modern day.
courses.recommended_textbooks: History of the Filipino People. Teodoro Agoncillo.
courses.recommended_websites: Ang Kasaysayan ng Pilipinas —- https://www.zenrooms.com/blog/post/kasaysayan-ng-pilipinas/

courses.subject: PHILO 1
courses.title: Philosophical Analysis
courses.description:
PHILO 1 is a GE 2018 subject that introduces philosophy as a field of study.

In this course students will learn about different great philosophers from the past up to the present. You will also learn about their philosophical ideas and their meaning.
courses.recommended_textbooks: Introduction to Philosophy: Philosophy of Religion. Beau Branson. Christina Hendricks.
courses.recommended_websites: Crash Course Philosophy —- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1A_CAkYt3GY&list=PLUHoo4L8qXthO958RfdrAL8XAHvk5xuu9

courses.subject: SOC SCI 1/2
courses.title: Foundations of Social Science / Social, Economic and Political Thought
courses.description: Soc Sci 2 is a GE 2018 subject that aims to teach students about various political thoughts and social science.
courses.recommended_textbooks: Great Philosophical Thinkers: Plato to the present. William Ebenstein. Alan O. Ebenstein.
courses.recommended_websites: Website Project for Social Science 2 —- https://tbllanto.wixsite.com/platwo

courses.subject: ENG 13
courses.title: Writing as Thinking
courses.description: ENG 13 is a GE 2018 subject that aims to teach students about writing. Students may expect to write essays on various topics. These topics mostly depend on the professor handling the course.
courses.recommended_textbooks: Writing for Success. University of Minessota.
courses.recommended_websites: Mastering Business Writing & Grammar —- https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL7x45KHuu46l1lMErNTx6gkTRMt48oRLV

courses.subject: SPEECH 30
courses.title: Public Speaking and Persuasion
courses.description: Speech 30 is a GE 2018 course that will push students to improve their public speaking skills. Students may expect to deliver an assortment of speeches while also being guided on how to construct them well.
courses.recommended_textbooks: Exploring Public Speaking - 4th Edition. Kris Barton. Barbara G. Tucker.
courses.recommended_websites: How To Speak by Patrick Winston —- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Unzc731iCUY

courses.subject: FIL 40
courses.title: Wika, Kultura, at Lipunan
courses.description: FIL 40 is a GE 2018 course that aims to teach its students to be proficient at writing in Filipino. Students may expect to write several essays in Filipino regarding various topics.
courses.recommended_textbooks: Ang wikang Filipino: atin ito. Consuelo J. Paz
courses.recommended_websites: Fil 40 Documentary —- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O77gXWstSXk&ab_channel=HarveyDelaCruz

courses.subject: ENG 30
courses.title: English for the Professions
courses.description: ENG 30 is a GE 2018 subject that will prepare students to write various literature needed in the workplace. Students may expect to learn how to write resumes, request letters, and more.
courses.recommended_textbooks: Technical Writing for Technicians. Will Fleming.
courses.recommended_websites: Resume Writing —- https://edu.gcfglobal.org/en/resumewriting/

courses.subject: STS 1/DRMAPS
courses.title: Science, Technology and Society / Disaster Risk Mitigation, Adaptation, and Preparedness Strategies
courses.description: STS 1 is a GE 2018 subject that helps students appreciate the significance that science has played throughout history. In this class you will hear lectures about the different fields of science and how they have contributed to society.
courses.recommended_textbooks:
Science, Technology, and Society: A Sociological Approach. Jennifer Croissant, Sal Restivo, and Wenda K. Bauchspies
The Structure of Scientific Revolutions. Thomas Kuhn
courses.recommended_websites: A History of Science and Technology in the Philippines —- https://phlconnect.ched.gov.ph/admin/uploads/da4902cb0bc38210839714ebdcf0efc3/01-Readings-4.pdf

courses.subject: GE *Free Choice
courses.title: General Education
courses.description: You are given a choice to take any of the other available GE courses classified by UP Diliman.

courses.subject: ELECTIVE *Free Choice
courses.description: You are also given the choice to take any course from any department you wish, given that you have taken the required prerequisite classes.

courses.subject: ENGG 150
courses.title: Introduction to Technology Entrepreneurship
courses.description: As of the 2nd semester of AY 2020-2021 this course has not been offered yet. As such, not much is known about this course except that it is related to Engineering

courses.subject: ARTS 1
courses.title: Critical Perspectives in the Arts
courses.description: Arts 1 is another GE 2018 course that aims to teach its students the importance of art and how to interpret it.
courses.recommended_textbooks:
Understanding Art. Lois Fichner-Rathus
Seven Days in the Art World. Sarah Thornton
courses.recommended_websites: Historical Overview of the Philippine Art —- https://www.sutori.com/story/copy-of-historical-overview-of-philippine-art--3q8Tzh9KTYTNLGHsdCEdivQ7

courses.subject: ELECTIVE *CS
courses.description: Another elective course you will have to take to complete your degree in computer science is a CS elective. Every semester the university offers various courses that cover topics such as web development and android development. In fact, this web app was developed for CS 176, an elective.

courses.subject: PI 100
courses.title: The Life and Works of Jose Rizal
courses.description: PI 100 is a GE course where you will discuss the various readings of our national hero Jose Rizal.
courses.recommended_textbooks:
Noli Me Tangere. Jose Rizal
El Fillibusterismo. Jose Rizal
Veneration Without Understanding. Renato Constantino
Noli as Catalyst of Revolution. John Schumacher
courses.recommended_websites: Jose Rizal —- https://www.britannica.com/biography/Jose-Rizal

courses.subject: PE
courses.title: Physical Education
courses.description: Over the course of your 4 years in UP, you will need to take part in 4 different physical education classes. Some specific sports have a second level class that allows you to further master a sport.

courses.subject: NSTP
courses.title: National Service Training Program
courses.description: The NSTP is another extra-curricular class that you must take. You may take three types of courses, the ROTC, where you will engage in military training, the LTS, where you will be trained to be able to teach people in need to gain basic literary skills, and CWTS, where you will take part in several programs and activities that serve to better the community.
